data.title: Convenient to the train station
data.text: I allow an additional 10 minutes to pick up donuts when I take the bus to CSUCI. Good donuts, not in the league of Rolling Pin on Las Posas Road, but worth taking out to the campus.

data.title: Best Donuts since the 80's.
data.text:
This place has the best donuts.  Get there early and you'll find them, but later in the afternoon and you won't.  Cash only, so be aware.  I haven't had donuts that satisfy my craving in decades, since I worked late shift at Kmart in Oxnard.  These do it, but with a little less variety and nothing late, sadly.
I love their sandwich croissants with ham, but they tend towards limp, but not enough to stop me from getting them.   I'm not sure if they're even open in the later afternoon/evenings at all, so the early bird and all that.
Their staff are friendly, but not perky, but you'll like them all the same.
Parking - It's a bit tight, so enter at either opening, but be careful on your way out due to traffic.  Be aware that people tend to slew around the corner very fast on the Lewis Road side, but charge for the corner on the Ventura Blvd side.  I do not recommend charging across Lewis Road towards the Metrolink Parking lot in order to travel North, back into town under the freeway - dangerous at best.  Leave via the Ventura Blvd. side and try to get into the turn lane, and definitely do not try to cross the lanes in an attempt to go West.  
If you get stuck, drive Lewis to the next stop light at Dawson Place and go right or left  and make a turn-about there.  I suggest the Left into the Crush Winery parking lot, it'll be easier and safer than any other, or you wind up driving in circles.
Wheelchairs - You can wheel your way to the front door at the parking lot corner, which is also the best place to park, near the corner mexican food place.

data.title: Storage Wars
data.text: nice clean little doughnut shop.... good service for a Sunday morning enjoyed our fresh doughnuts along with Starbucks coffee.... i liked the light weight pastry and cinnamon roll

data.title: Nice Little Find
data.text: I usually get up early when we travel to go photograph the surrounding area. On my way back I asked Siri to find some local donut shop. I picked one of suggestions (Donut Queen). I was pleasantly surprised the donuts were quite good and cheap. $5 for 3 donuts, milk, and OJ.

data.title: good donuts
data.text: donuts good, muffins good had been recommended by fellow passenger on local bus

data.title: Great donuts any time you want one.
data.text: This is a little donut shop near the train station in Camarillo.  I would not write a review about a donut shop unless there was something special about it.  This place makes really good donuts.  A nice treat with a hot cup of not so good coffee.  They always have dozens of type of donuts, all are good. The shop is always open.  Rush hour is around 6AM, when workers come in for breakfast or a mid-morning snack to go.
